tool_description: Controls stress testing scenarios by gradually increasing load beyond normal capacity to identify breaking points and system limits.

initial_load.description: Starting load level in requests per second (1-1000)

max_load.description: Maximum load level in requests per second (100-50000)

increment_step.description: Load increment per step in requests per second (1-1000)

step_duration_minutes.description: Duration of each load step in minutes (1-30)

failure_threshold_percent.description: Error rate threshold to stop test (1-50)

error_messages: Invalid load parameters: initial_load must be less than max_load and within valid ranges
Invalid increment step: Must be between 1 and 1000, and should not exceed max_load difference
Invalid step duration: Must be between 1 and 30 minutes
Invalid failure threshold: Must be between 1 and 50 percent
usage: Define initial_load, max_load, and increment_step for progressive load increase. Configure step_duration_minutes and failure_threshold_percent to control test progression and stopping criteria.

stress_test_id.description: Unique identifier for this stress test

current_load.description: Current load level in requests per second

breaking_point.description: Load level where system performance degraded significantly

test_status.description: Current test status (running, completed, failed, stopped)
